Package org.husky.emed.ch.models.treatment

Class MedicationTreatment

java.lang.Object
org.husky.emed.ch.models.treatment.MedicationTreatment
public class MedicationTreatment extends Object
An representation of the state of a medication in the treatment plan at a given time.

The medication treatment is constructed with item aggregators. It should not be modified elsewhere, as it requires a lot of business logic.

TODO: check all dates: inclusives or exclusives? PRE stop time is exclusive in digest...

Author:
Quentin Ligier

    • lastMedicalAuthor

      protected @Nullable AuthorDigest lastMedicalAuthor
      The author of the last item entry (of type MTP, PRE, or any type of PADV except COMMENT that apply to an MTP or PRE) in this treatment. This is the last "medical" participant.

    • treatmentStatus

      protected TreatmentStatus treatmentStatus
      The actual status of the treatment.

      TODO: Can it change with the date?

    • treatmentStopTime

      protected @Nullable Instant treatmentStopTime
      The treatment stop time (inclusive). It's the maximum time at which the medication treatment can be valid. If null, the treatment is active forever (or until stopped).

  • Constructor Details

      public MedicationTreatment()

  • Method Details

    • isTreatmentActive

      public boolean isTreatmentActive()
      Returns whether the treatment is active now.

      A medication treatment is active at date D if:

      • The MTP Item is active, i.e. it started before or at date D and ended after date D;
      • The MTP Item has not been made inactive by a PADV Item.

    • mayHavePrescriptionReadyForValidationInTheFuture

      public boolean mayHavePrescriptionReadyForValidationInTheFuture()
      Checks if one of the prescriptions contained in the medication treatment may be ready for validation. The start dates of the treatment and the prescription are not checked because it could be not ready for validation when the status is calculated but effectively ready for validation when the PHARM-1 query comes. The end dates are checked because that could not happen.

      The result is stored in the Mongo collection to facilitate PHARM-1 query search.

      Returns:
      true if one of the prescriptions is ready for validation, false otherwise.

    • mayHavePrescriptionReadyForDispenseInTheFuture

      public boolean mayHavePrescriptionReadyForDispenseInTheFuture()
      Checks if one of the prescriptions contained in the medication treatment may be ready for dispense. The start dates of the treatment and the prescription are not checked because it could be not ready for dispense when the status is calculated but effectively ready for dispense when the PHARM-1 query comes. The end dates are checked because that could not happen.

      The result is stored in the Mongo collection to facilitate PHARM-1 query search.

      Returns:
      true if one of the prescriptions is ready for dispense, false otherwise.

    • isPrescriptionReadyForValidation

      public boolean isPrescriptionReadyForValidation(MedicationPrescription prescription)
      Checks if a prescription contained in this medication treatment is ready for validation now.
      Parameters:
      prescription - The prescription to check.
      Returns:
      true if the prescription is ready for validation now, false otherwise.
